publications.name: Relationship Between Growth Trajectories and Functional Traits for Woody Trees in a Secondary Tropical Forest
publications.publisher: Frontiers in Forests and Global Change
publications.summary: Our findings supports the idea that traits describing plant size and tree shape, such as maximum height, canopy volume and height to diameter ratio, were generally the best predictors of species growth parameters throughout ontogeny, even though traits representing resource-use and reproductive strategies also played a significant role.

publications.name: The Atlantic Forest: An Introduction to the Megadiverse Forest of South America
publications.publisher: [Book chapter] The Atlantic Forest: History, biodiversity, threats and opportunities of the mega-diverse Forest,
publications.summary: In this book chapter, we introduce the Atlantic Forest hotspos, focusing on describing the evolution of knowledge, the geographical limits, and the current proposals of sectorization in ecological units.

publications.name: Climate change shifts the distribution of vegetation types in South Brazilian hotspots
publications.summary: We integrated ecological niche modeling with paleoecological data to elucidate the potential impacts of past and future climate change on the distribution of multiple vegetation types occurring in southern Brazil.

publications.name: GenExcel de Populacoes: Genetica de Populacoes no Excel
publications.summary: This paper introduces didactic software that can be used to simulate the effects of evolutionary factors on the gene pool of a population.

publications.name: Percepcao da teoria da evolucao por alunos de Biologia de uma universidade portuguesa e de uma universidade brasileira: uma analise comparativa
publications.summary: We examined whether variations in teaching structures and guiding pedagogical documents between Brazil and Portugal influence students' understanding of evolutionary theory.
